Electronic Theatre Controls’ Privacy, Cookie, Terms of Use, and Acceptable Use Policies


Privacy Policy Terms of Use Policy

Cookie Policy Acceptable Use Policy


Privacy Policy
Last Updated: January 24, 2024

This Privacy Policy describes the information collected through this website “Site” and how that information is used and shared. Electronic Theatre Controls, Inc., and its affiliates, (“ETC,” “we,” “us,” or “our”) may collect or receive the types of information described below in connection with your access to and use of the Site, including your account registration on the Site and any information you may post to the site (together, “Collected Information”). If you are a California or Virginia resident, please see our CA Privacy Rights page: https://www.etcconnect.com/CA-Privacy-Rights/

Please read this Privacy Policy and the Terms of Use carefully to understand our policies and practices regarding Collected Information and how we use and share it. By accessing, using or submitting information via this Site, you agree on behalf of yourself and any company that you represent (together, “you” and “your”) to this Privacy Policy, our Terms of Use Policy, and our Acceptable Use Policy, in addition to ETC’s use and sharing of information as discussed below. If you do not agree with this Privacy Policy, please do not access or use this Site.

This Privacy Policy is incorporated into and made a part of our Terms of Use.


Changes to this Privacy Policy
We may amend or otherwise modify this Privacy Policy at any time. All modifications will take effect immediately upon posting of the updated Privacy Policy on the Site. By accessing or using the Site after modifications are posted, you agree to those modifications. Material changes will be conspicuously posted on the Site. You are encouraged to revisit this Privacy Policy from time to time in order to review any changes that have been made. The date on which this Privacy Policy was last updated is noted at the beginning of this Privacy Policy.

General
ETC respects the privacy of all visitors to the Site. Whether you provide us with your personally identifiable information is your decision. You do not have to tell us who you are or reveal anything further about yourself to visit this Site. We collect only the information necessary to maintain a satisfactory business relationship with you or your company.

Notwithstanding the above, we may collect and use other information that may be considered personally identifiable information in some jurisdictions (such as your IP address) in order to make our website accessible to you. Such information will automatically be transmitted by your computer. Without your explicit consent, we will not use such information for any other purpose than making the Site accessible to you.

This Privacy Policy does not apply to information that we may collect through any medium other than the Site (e.g., collected offline), or to information collected by any person or entity other than us (such as a third-party website or a third-party application).

Information about ETC’s Data Transfer Practices
ETC’s subsidiaries around the world, including those within the European Economic Area (EEA) and the United Kingdom (UK), transfer PII to ETC’s headquarters, located in Middleton, Wisconsin, USA. Such data transfers are made pursuant to Standard Contractual Clauses, as advised by the European Data Protection Board. ETC actively monitors guidance and regulations pertaining to data transfers around the world and endeavors to update its practices as necessary.

Electronic Theatre Controls, Inc. commits to resolve complaints about your privacy and our collection or use of your personal information. Individuals with inquiries or complaints regarding this privacy policy should contact Electronic Theatre Controls, Inc. at:

ETC - Attention Office of General Counsel
3031 Pleasant View Road
Middleton, WI 53562
USA
Email: privacy@etcconnect.com

Information about Electronic Theatre Controls GmbH’s Data Protection Officer
Pursuant to Section 38 of the German Data Protection Amendment Act, Electronic Theatre Controls GmbH has appointed the following Data Protection Officer:

Dr. Sebastian Kraska
Marienplatz 2
80331 Munich
Germany
Email: dpo-contact@iitr.de

Information We Collect
Here is the information we collect through our Site and how we use it:

Personally Identifiable Information. In this Privacy Policy, "personally identifiable information" (PII) means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person or reasonably capable of being associated with or linked with a consumer or household, including but not limited to an individual's name, postal address, e-mail address, and phone number. You can visit the Site without sharing PII, but you will be required to provide PII in order to use certain Site features.
MyETC. MyETC is an added feature of this Site that allows you to customize your experience on the Site and access information for your type of membership. If you choose to open a MyETC account, we will collect the following PII from you, through third party processor LoginRadius, for the purpose(s) listed in the chart below:
Data Collected	Purpose for Collection	Legitimate Grounds for Collection
First and Last Name*	Set up MyETC account	Performance of a contract - necessary for setting up MyETC account
Email*	Set up MyETC account;
marketing purposes	Performance of a contract - necessary for setting up MyETC account; Consent for marketing purposes
Country*	Set up MyETC account	Performance of a contract - necessary for setting up MyETC account
Display name and Password*	Set up MyETC account	Performance of a contract - necessary for setting up MyETC account
Address	Marketing	Consent
Phone number	Marketing	Consent
Organization	Marketing	Consent
Occupation	Marketing	Consent
Industry	Marketing	Consent

*Required to set up MyETC account

Use of PII for Marketing. Marketing emails are sent via a third party, HubSpot, Inc. (“HubSpot”). If you do not wish to receive promotional materials, marketing materials email offers or newsletters from us, you can opt-out of receiving such information from us (other than emails related to the completion of your registration, correction of user data, change of password and other similar communications essential to your transactions on the Site) by using the unsubscribe process at the bottom of the email, by checking the relevant box located on the form on which we collect your data, adjusting your user preferences in your MyETC account profile, if applicable, or by sending us an email stating your request to webmaster@etcconnect.com.

Product Registration. If you have opened a MyETC account, you will have the choice to register any of our products you or your organization have purchased. Registration of these products is not required. If you choose to register a product, we will collect the following PII from you, for the purpose(s) listed in the chart below:
Data Collected	Purpose for Collection	Legitimate Grounds for Collection
Company Name or Individual Name*	Register Product	Performance of a contract - necessary for registering product
Address*	Register Product	Performance of a contract - necessary for registering product
Phone Number*	Register Product	Performance of a contract - necessary for registering product

*Required to register a product

Contacting ETC through the Site. You may contact us via the Site, or by calling or writing to us. If you choose to contact us, we will collect the following PII from you through third party processor HubSpot, for the purpose(s) listed in the chart below:
Data Collected	Purpose for Collection	Legitimate Grounds for Collection
Name*	Respond to your inquiry	Performance of a contract - necessary for responding to your inquiry
Email*	Respond to your inquiry	Performance of a contract - necessary for responding to your inquiry
Phone Number*	Respond to your inquiry	Performance of a contract - necessary for responding to your inquiry

*Required to contact us

ETC’s Online Community. If you have opened a MyETC account, you may participate in ETC’s Online Community forum (the “Forum”). No additional PII is collected to enable you to participate in the Forum and you are not required to share any PII in order to post on the Forum. Anything you post to the Forum, however, is visible by all Forum participants and will be saved. At any time, you may request deletion of your Forum account, and/or any PII that you included within a Forum post. We will process your deletion request within 30 days of receiving your request. By posting on the Forum, you consent to the cross-border transfer of any PII you have shared; you also consent to our Terms of Use and Acceptable Use Policies.
HES Forum. HES Forum is an added feature of this Site that allows you access to information regarding our products, services, and expertise, as well as to add your own content. Anything you post to the Forum is visible by all Forum participants and will be saved until you request deletion of your post or deletion of your entire HES Forum account. We will then delete your post and/or account along with your PII within 30 days of receiving your request. You are not required to share any PII in order to post on the Forum. By posting on the Forum, you consent to the cross-border transfer of any PII you have shared; you also consent to our Terms of Use and Acceptable Use Policies. If you choose to register an HES Forum account, we will collect the following PII from you, through third party processor LoginRadius, for the purpose(s) listed in the chart below:
Data Collected	Purpose for Collection	Legitimate Grounds for Collection
Username*	Submit Request	Performance of a contract - necessary for submitting request
Email*	Submit Request	Performance of a contract - necessary for submitting request
Role (Manufacturer, Owner, or User)*	Submit Request	Performance of a contract - necessary for submitting request
*Required to register an HES Forum account

Fixture Library. You may use this form to submit requests for Hog console fixture libraries. If you choose to submit a request, we will collect the following PII from you through third party processor Atlassian, for the purpose(s) listed in the chart below:
Data Collected	Purpose for Collection	Legitimate Grounds for Collection
Username*	Set up an HES Forum account	Performance of a contract - necessary for setting up an HES Forum account
Email*	Set up an HES Forum account	Performance of a contract - necessary for setting up an HES Forum account
Password*	Set up an HES Forum account	Performance of a contract - necessary for setting up an HES Forum account
*Required to submit a request from the fixture library

Financial Information. You may purchase ETC swag and other items through https://shop.etcconnect.com/ or ( https://shop.etcconnect.eu/ if you are located in the EU). Purchases of products or services must be made by credit or debit card. All credit and debit card information is provided directly to our PCI-compliant third-party payment processor BigCommerce. We do not directly access or handle any financial information collected via this Site. If you make a debit or credit card payment online, you will be taken to a website operated by BigCommerce, who will take your payment. Payment by credit or debit card is subject to the approval of the card issuer. We will not be liable in any way if a card issuer refuses to accept a credit or debit card for any reason. You should not communicate credit card or other payment information via email, as it is not secure. To make a purchase, the following PII will be collected from you, for the purpose(s) listed in the chart below:
Data Collected	Purpose for Collection	Legitimate Grounds for Collection
Name*	Place Order	Performance of a contract - necessary to place order
Email*	Place Order	Performance of a contract – necessary to place order
Company Name	Place Order	Performance of a contract – necessary to place order
Phone Number*	Place Order	Performance of a contract – necessary to place order
Address*	Place Order	Performance of a contract – necessary to place order
Payment Information*	Place Order	Performance of a contract – necessary to place order

*Required to make purchase

Online Training. You may register for online training through the Site. If you choose to register for online training, we will collect the following PII from you through third party processor Web Courseworks, Ltd., Docebo NA, Inc., and LoginRadius, for the purpose(s) listed in the chart below:
Data Collected	Purpose for Collection	Legitimate Grounds for Collection
Name*	Registration for online training	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for online training
Company Name	Registration for online training	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for online training
Phone Number*	Registration for online training	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for online training
Address*	Registration for online training	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for online training
Payment Information*	Registration for online training	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for online training
*Required to register for online training

Technical Training. You may register for technical training through the Site. If you choose to register for technical training, we will collect the following PII from you through third party processor Cvent, and LoginRadius, for the purpose(s) listed in the chart below:
Data Collected	Purpose for Collection	Legitimate Grounds for Collection
Name*	Registration for technical training	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for technical training
Company Name/Organization
/School*	Registration for technical training	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for technical training
Email Address*	Registration for technical training;
marketing purposes**	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for technical training; consent for marketing purposes
Phone Number*	Registration for technical training	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for technical training
Address*	Registration for technical training	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for technical training
Payment Information*	Registration for technical training	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for technical training
*Required to register for technical training

**Marketing emails are sent via a third party, HubSpot.

Conferences Registration. You may register for ETC conferences through the Site. If you choose to register for an ETC conference, we will collect the following PII from you through third party processor Cvent and LoginRadius, for the purpose(s) listed in the chart below:
Data Collected	Purpose for Collection	Legitimate Grounds for Collection
Name*	Registration for conference	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for conference
Company*	Registration for conference	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for conference
Job title	Registration for conference	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for conference
Email Address*	Registration for conference;
marketing purposes**	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for conference; consent for marketing purposes
Phone Number work*
and mobile	Registration for conference	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for conference
Address*	Registration for conference	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for conference
Payment Information*	Registration for conference	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for conference
*Required to register for conference

**Marketing emails are sent via a third party, HubSpot.

Support.etcconnect.com. ETC offers support.etcconnect.com as an additional support tool for our end users. If you choose to access this support site while logged into your MyETC account, the support site will keep track of the pages you view for thirty days through third party administrator MindTouch. ETC may use this information to tailor the support site’s content in order to better serve our end users. If you do not want your navigation of the support site to be tracked, please sign out of your MyETC account before navigating the support site. Please note, some content on the support site will not be available to you if you are not logged into your MyETC account.

If you choose to stay logged into your MyETC account while navigating the support site, the following PII will be collect from you through third party administrator MindTouch, for the purpose(s) listed in the chart below:

Data Collected	Purpose for Collection	Legitimate Grounds for Collection
Navigation of support site	Tailor support site’s content	Legitimate interest of ETC
Schedule a Demo. You may schedule a demo of ETC products through our website. If you choose to schedule a demo, we will collect the following PII from you through third party processor Microsoft, for the purpose(s) listed in the chart below:

Data Collected	Purpose for Collection	Legitimate Grounds for Collection
Name*	Registration for demo	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for demo
Email Address*	Registration for demo	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for demo
Phone Number*	Registration for demo	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for demo
City, State/Province/Region, Country* (needed to determine which ETC office will organize demo)	Registration for demo	Performance of a contract - necessary to register for demo
Venue/company	Registration for demo	Your consent
*Required to register for demo
Other Information
When you access and interact with the Site, we will make temporary use of other information in addition to the PII mentioned above as technically necessary in order to make the Site accessible to you, including the IP address of the device you are using to access the Site. Such information will automatically be transmitted by your computer. Without your explicit consent, we will not use such information for any other purpose than making the website accessible to you. In addition, we will destroy such information after seven days.

We may also collect other information in addition to the PII mentioned above about those visits. For example, our servers may receive and record information about your computer, device, and browser, including potentially the IP address, browser type, and other software or hardware information. This information is never used to identify you personally and never combined with other personal data such as PII stored in your MyETC account or otherwise sent to us through our website. Such information includes the following:

Usage Details and IP Address. As you navigate through this Site, details of your visits to this Site, including, but not limited to, traffic data, location data, logs, the resources that you access, and information about your computer and internet connection, including your truncated IP address, operating system and browser type may be automatically transmitted by your computer. We may use this information for system administration and access to the Site.
Cookies. "Cookies" are pieces of information that a website sends to your computer while you are viewing a website. To see our Cookie Policy, click here.
Web beacons. "Web beacons" are electronic images, tags or scripts that allow a website to access cookies and help track general usage patterns of visitors to a website. Web beacons can recognize certain types of information, such as cookies, time and date of a page view and a description of the page where the Web beacon is placed. We may use Web beacons to compile information regarding use of this Site.
Profiling. We will not use your PII for decisions based solely on automated processing if the decision produces legal effects concerning you or significantly affects you, unless you gave your explicit consent for this processing.
Security. We are committed to ensuring that your personal data is secure. In order to prevent unauthorized access or disclosure, we have put in place appropriate technical and organizational measures to safeguard and secure the personal data we process. Although we use reasonable security measures to help protect against the loss, misuse, and alteration of information under our control, we cannot ensure or guarantee that loss, misuse, or alteration of your personally identifiable information or other Collected Information will not occur. If, despite all our efforts, a data breach does occur, we shall take all reasonable steps to limit the damage. In case of a data breach which is likely to result in a high risk, and depending on the circumstances, we will inform you about remedial actions to prevent any further damage when required under applicable law. We will also inform the relevant supervisory authority or authorities without undue delay, when required under applicable law.
Disclosure of PII. We will only disclose PII to our affiliated companies, agents, and/or subcontractors for the purposes identified above, where necessary. In such cases, the agent or subcontractor will be obligated to use that PII in accordance with the terms of this Privacy Policy. We will not sell, distribute or lease your PII to third parties unless we have your permission or are required to do so by law. We may disclose your PII to the extent that it is required to do so by applicable law, in connection with any legal proceedings or prospective legal proceedings, and in order to establish, exercise, or defend our legal rights.
We may be required to release personal data of EU individuals in response to lawful requests from public authorities including to meet national security and law enforcement requirements.

Aggregation and De-Personalization (Pseudonymisation). We may take your PII, make it non-personally identifiable and combine it with other Collected Information about other individuals. Such aggregated information describes users as a group but does not reveal the identity of individual users. We may use and disclose to third parties such aggregate or de-personalized information in any manner and without notice or compensation to you.
Business Transfers. We specifically and expressly reserve the right to disclose, lease, sell, assign and transfer Collected Information (including your PII) to the successor or acquiring entity in the event of or in connection with a Business Transfer. A "Business Transfer" means a sale, acquisition, merger, consolidation, reorganization, bankruptcy or other corporate change of control involving us, regardless of whether the Business Transfer relates to a part or a whole of our business. Before we disclose your PII in the context of a Business Transfer, we will notify you and give you a reasonable time period to object to such transfer. That successor or acquiring entity will be bound by this Privacy Policy as it applies to that information. Nothing in this Privacy Policy is intended to interfere with our ability to transfer all or part of our business, equity, and/or assets (including this Site) to an affiliate or independent third party at any time, for any purpose, without any limitation, without notice, any without any compensation to you, whatsoever.
Third Party Transfers. Under certain circumstances, we may remain liable for the acts of our third-party agents or service providers who perform services on our behalf for their handling of EU Personal Data that we transfer to them.
Retention of PII. We will retain your PII while your MyETC or or HES Forum account is still active. You may contact us as instructed below to request your MyETC or HES Forum account be deleted. We will then delete your account along with your PII within 30 days of receiving your request. If you place an order through the ETC Swag Store, we will have to store the PII relating to such order for at least as long as necessary to fulfil the order and as long as necessary for compliance with statutory tax and accounting requirements in accordance with our Record Retention Policy, even if you do not have a MyETC or HES Forum account or if your MyETC or HES Forum account has meanwhile been deleted. Please contact the relevant third party for information regarding data retention collected through that third party.
User Generated Content. You are responsible for any content, including PII that you create, post, or otherwise submit to be published or displayed (“posted”) on this Site ("User Generated Content"). Your User Generated Content is posted on and transmitted to other users of this Site at your own risk. We cannot control the actions of other users of this Site with whom you may choose to share your User Generated Content. As a result, we cannot and do not guarantee that your User Generated Content will not be viewed by unauthorized persons. You understand and acknowledge that, even after removal, copies of User Generated Content may remain viewable in cached and archived pages, or might have been copied or stored by other Site users. For information on submitting User Generated Content, please review our Terms of Use and Acceptable Use Policies. We may use and disclose User Generated Content, excluding components that consist of PII, in any manner and with any person.
Information You Disclose to Third Parties. You may be presented with an opportunity to receive information and/or marketing offers from third parties as a result of your access to or use of this Site. This Privacy Policy does not apply to such information. All information you disclose to such third parties will be subject to the privacy policies and practices of such third parties, as applicable. We will not have access to any information you choose to disclose to such third parties. We are not responsible for the privacy policies or practices of any third party. You should review the privacy policies and practices of each third party prior to disclosing information to them.
You may have the opportunity to connect to other online services through the Site. These online services may operate independently from us, and they may have their own privacy notices or policies. If any online service which is linked to the Site is not owned or controlled by us, or does not claim to be covered by this Privacy Policy, we are not responsible for it and it is not covered by this Privacy Policy. Please refer to the privacy policy associated with that online service.
Access by Children. The Site is not directed at children under 16 years of age. You must be at least 16 years of age to register with or use this Site. We do not knowingly collect or use information from children under 16 through the Site. If you are under 16 years of age, do not send any information about yourself to us or otherwise enter any information about yourself on this Site, including your name, address, telephone number or e-mail address. If you believe that we might have any information from or about a child under 16 years of age, please contact us at privacy@etcconnect.com.
Site Access From Outside the United States. This Site is operated in the United States. If you are located in the European Union, Canada or elsewhere outside of the United States please be aware that Collected Information will be transferred to, stored, and processed in the United States. If you open a MyETC account or HES Forum account, or post to either Forum, you acknowledge that your data will be processed in the United States.
Right to Access Correct and Delete, Withdraw Consent, Restrict, and Object to, Processing Your PII. If you have created a MyETC account or HES Forum account through this Site, then you have the right to access, review, and update your PII by logging into this Site, visiting your account profile page and making changes, including submitting a request to delete your account information.

You also have the right to request: the categories of, and specific pieces of, personal information we have collected about you, if any; the categories of sources from which we collected this personal information, if any; the business or commercial purpose for which we collected this personal information, if any; and the categories of third parties with whom we have shared this personal information, if any.

You also have the right to request access details of any PII which we hold about you, to restrict or object to our processing of your PII, and to request we delete any pieces of personal information we have on you, if any.

We will not discriminate against you in any way for exercising any of your rights listed above.

We will require that you verify the username and/or email address associated with your account or order in order to verify your identity before performing any of the requests discussed above. If using an authorized agent to make a request, we will require a written and signed statement giving the authorized agent permission to make the request on your behalf.

We do not sell any PII. We may disclose PII to a third party for a business purpose, as detailed in this Privacy Policy under Section 4 – Information We Collect.

Where you have given us consent to process your PII, you may withdraw this consent at any time.

If you have questions or concerns about our privacy practices or this Privacy Policy or wish to make a request regarding your PII, please contact us at any of the following:

Cookie Policy (not the good kind)
Last update: January 24, 2024

This Cookie Policy explains what cookies are and how we (Electronic Theatre Controls, Inc., and its affiliates) use them. Please read this Cookie Policy carefully to understand our policies and practices regarding the information we collect using cookies and how we use and share that information. We strive to keep this policy up to date, but we cannot guarantee its accuracy at all times. In addition, we may update this Cookie Policy from time to time.

What are cookies?
"Cookies" are pieces of information that a website sends to your computer while you are viewing that website. We may set and access the cookies listed below on your computer to track and store preferential information about you. Please note that most Internet browsers will allow you to stop cookies from being stored on your computer and to delete cookies stored on your computer. If you do not wish us to collect cookies, you may set your browser to refuse cookies, or to alert you when cookies are being sent. If you do so, please note that some parts of this Site may then be inaccessible or may not function properly. If you are located in the European Union, you can use our cookie control tool to turn off certain cookies. Please see below for directions on how to use our cookie control tool.

Types of cookies
Essential Cookies. Essential cookies are required in order to make our site run. These cookies run automatically when you visit our site and cannot be turned off. Without these cookies, our site would not work as it should. Below is a list of the essential cookies used on each of our sites:

YOUR USE OF THE SITE IS AT YOUR OWN RISK AND YOU, ALONE, ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY DAMAGE TO YOUR COMPUTER HARDWARE, SOFTWARE, SYSTEMS, AND NETWORKS, ANY LOSS OF DATA THAT RESULTS FROM THE DOWNLOAD OF ANY INFORMATION FROM THE SITE, AND FOR ANY OTHER DAMAGE THAT MAY BE INCURRED. WE MAKE NO REPRESENTATION THAT THE SITE IS APPROPRIATE OR AVAILABLE FOR USE IN LOCATIONS OTHER THAN THE UNITED STATES. IF YOU CHOOSE TO ACCESS THE SITE FROM LOCATIONS OTHER THAN THE UNITED STATES, YOU DO SO AT YOUR OWN RISK AND YOU ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR COMPLYING WITH APPLICABLE LAWS AND REGULATIONS. NO ADVICE OR INFORMATION, ORAL OR WRITTEN, OBTAINED BY YOU FROM ETC OR IN ANY MANNER FROM THE SITE CREATES ANY WARRANTY.
NO LIABILITY. TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, IN NO EVENT WILL ETC, ITS AFFILIATES, OR ITS OR THEIR RESPECTIVE DIRECTORS, OFFICERS, EMPLOYEES, REPRESENTATIVES, CONSULTANTS, AGENTS, SUPPLIERS, OR LICENSORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, EXEMPLARY, PUNITIVE, OR CONSEQUENTIAL LOSS OR DAMAGE, OR ANY OTHER LOSS OR DAMAGE OF ANY KIND, ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SITE OR YOUR USE OF THE SITE (INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION THE INPUT OF PERSONALLY IDENTIFIABLE AND OTHER INFORMATION INTO THE SITE), WHETHER THE CLAIM IS BASED IN CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), STRICT LIABILITY, WARRANTY, OR OTHERWISE, AND EVEN IF ETC HAS EXPRESS KNOWLEDGE OF THE POSSIBILITY OF THE LOSS OR DAMAGE. YOUR SOLE AND EXCLUSIVE REMEDY IS TO STOP ACCESSING AND USING THE SITE. WITHOUT LIMITING THE FOREGOING, IN NO EVENT WILL ETC’S LIABILITY TO YOU EXCEED $100, EVEN IF THIS REMEDY FAILS OF ITS ESSENTIAL PURPOSE. SOME JURISDICTIONS DO NOT ALLOW THE EXCLUSION OR LIMITATION OF CERTAIN DAMAGES, SO SOME OF THE ABOVE EXCLUSIONS AND LIMITATIONS MAY NOT APPLY TO YOU.
Indemnification. You will indemnify, defend, and hold harmless ETC, its affiliates, and its and their respective directors, officers, employees, representatives, consultants, agents, suppliers, and licensors from and against all losses, claims, liabilities, demands, complaints, actions, damages, judgments, settlements, fines, penalties, damages, expenses, and costs (including without limitation reasonable attorneys’ fees) that arise out of or in connection with your access to or use of the Site, your misuse of any material, data, or other information downloaded or otherwise obtained from the Site, your submission of User Generated Content, your order of products through the Site, or your violation of these Terms. We reserve, and you grant to us, the exclusive right to assume the defense and control of any matter subject to indemnification by you.
Third-Party Websites. The Site may link to, or be linked to, websites not maintained or controlled by ETC. Acceptable Use Policy
Last updated: October 22, 2019

By submitting creating, posting, or otherwise submitting comments, images, data, text, or other content via this website (“Site”), or by responding to content submitted by others (together, “User Generated Content”), you agree to this Acceptable Use Policy (“AUP”).

If you do not agree with this AUP, please do not submit User Generated Content via the Site. This AUP is incorporated into and made a part of our Terms of Use.

We reserve the right to modify this AUP at any time. All changes will be effective immediately upon posting to the Site and, by accessing or using the Site after changes are posted, you agree to those changes.

You must maintain a polite, pleasant, and respectful environment.
You will not attack other Site users. User Generated Content that harasses, abuses, stalks, threatens, or otherwise violates the legal rights of others (such as the rights of privacy and publicity) is prohibited.
User Generated Content must be relevant to the stated topic (for example, the applicable forum post).
User Generated Content that is defamatory, indecent, pornographic, obscene, or otherwise objectionable is prohibited. Slurs and commentary against social, racial, religious, ethnic, and sexual orientation groups are prohibited.
User Generated Content must not contain or consist of surveys, contests, pyramid schemes, chain letters, junk mail, unauthorized emails, offers to buy or sell goods or services, advertisements, or commercial solicitations, nor may User Generated Content engage in, facilitate, or encourage any of the foregoing or any illegal activities.
You may not harvest or otherwise collect information about others (including without limitation email addresses).
You must have the rights, permissions, and consents necessary to submit the applicable User Generated Content. For example, you may not submit any User Generated Content that contains or consists of text, images, videos, recordings, or other material that is protected by intellectual property laws and owned by another person unless you have the legal right to submit that User Generated Content.
User Generated Content that contains viruses, Trojan horses, worms, time bombs, cancelbots, corrupted files, malicious code, or other software or programs that may damage a person’s software or hardware is prohibited.
You may not falsify or delete any copyright management information, such as author attributions, copyright notices, legal notices, or other proprietary designations, notices, or labels concerning the origin or source of the submitted User Generated Content.
You may not download User Generated Content submitted by another Site user if you know or reasonably should know that such User Generated Content cannot be legally copied, reproduced, displayed, performed, or distributed in such manner.
You may not interfere, restrict, or inhibit another user’s access to or use of the Site or its features.
You may not create a false identity, hide your true identity, or impersonate or represent any person other than yourself.
AUP Violations. Your violation of this AUP or any other provision of our Terms of Use may result in the immediate suspension of your access to the Site or its features without notice to you. ETC reserves the right to impose limits on Site features (for example, the ability to submit User Generated Content) or restrict your access to all or parts of the Site at any time for any reason, including without limitation your violation of this AUP.

Contact Us. Please direct any questions and concerns regarding this AUP or User Generated Content to us at the contact information below. Please do not direct questions, complaints, or other comments regarding User Generated Content to other Site users. As ETC does not monitor or review User Generated Content, we cannot address your concerns unless you send them to us.

Privacy Policy
Last Updated: January 1, 2023

This Privacy Policy (“Policy”) notifies you about Electronic Theatre Controls, Inc., and its affiliates (“ETC,” “we,” “our,” or “us”) privacy practices, including how we collect, use, and disclose information about you when you access or use our website at www.etcconnect.com (“Services”), or when you otherwise interact with us online, such as through our customer support channels or on social media pages.

Certain states, including California and Virginia, require additional information regarding our privacy practices and your privacy rights. If you are a resident of those states (“Consumer”), we provide you additional notices about our privacy practices and consumer rights relating to your personal information or personal data, as defined under those laws. If you are a California or Virginia resident, please see the California and Other States Notice of Collection and Privacy Rights section. 

We may change this Policy from time to time. If we make material changes, we will notify you by revising the date at the top of this Policy and, in some cases, we may provide you with additional notice (such as adding a statement to the Services or sending you a notification). We encourage you to review the Policy often to stay informed about our information practices and the choices available to you.

CONTENTS
Collection of Information
Use of Information
Disclosures of Information
Advertising and Analytics
Transfer of Information to the United States and Other Countries
Your Choices
California and Other States Notice of Collection and Privacy Rights
Additional Disclosures for Individuals in Europe
Contact Us

COLLECTION OF INFORMATION
Information You Provide to Us
We collect information you provide directly to us. For example, we collect information directly from you when you sign up for emails on our Services, create an account, fill out a form, submit or post content through our online community forum, make a purchase, communicate with us via third-party platforms, participate in a contest or promotion, request customer support, or otherwise communicate with us online. The types of information about you that we collect include your:

First and last name
Telephone number
Email address
Mailing address
Company details
Associated university and teacher (if you are a student using our ETCnomad Education Package).
Username and password if you create an account
Any other information you provide us
Additionally, if you make a purchase, we work with a third-party payment processor to collect and process your payment information.

Information We Collect Automatically
We automatically collect certain information about your interactions with us or our Services, including:

Activity Information: We collect information about your activity on our Services, such as when you register a product on our Services or submit requests for Hog console fixture libraries.
Transactional Information: When you make a purchase or return, we collect information about the transaction, such as product details, purchase price, and the date and location of the transaction.
Device and Usage Information: We collect information about how you access our Services, including data about the device and network you use, such as your hardware model, operating system version, mobile network, IP address, unique device identifiers, browser type, and app version. We also collect information about your activity on our Services, such as access times, pages viewed, links clicked, and the page you visited before navigating to our Services.
Information Collected by Cookies and Similar Tracking Technologies: We (and those who perform work for us) use tracking technologies, such as cookies and web beacons, to collect information about your interactions with the Services. Cookies are small data files stored on your hard drive or in device memory that help us improve our Services and your experience, see which areas and features of our Services are popular, and count visits. Web beacons (also known as “pixel tags” or “clear GIFs”) are electronic images that we use on our Services and in our emails to help deliver cookies, count visits, and understand usage and campaign effectiveness. For more information about cookies and how to disable them, see our Cookie Policy (https://www.etcconnect.com/Privacy-Policy-Terms-of-Use-and-Acceptable-Use.aspx#cookie) and the Your Choices section below.
 

Information We Collect from Other Sources
We may obtain information from other sources. For example, we may collect information about you when you interact with us through ETC or HES forums, our fixture library, registering for a conference, scheduling a demo, or through our online training Services.

Information We Derive
We may derive information or draw inferences about you based on the information we collect. For example, we may make inferences about your approximate location based on your IP address.

USE OF INFORMATION
We use the information we collect to provide, maintain, and improve the Services, and keep you informed about new products and services. We also use the information we collect to:

Develop or improve products and services, including to debug and repair errors in our Services;
Personalize your experience with us;
Send you technical notices, security alerts, support messages and other transactional or relationship messages;
Communicate with you about products, services, and events offered by ETC and others and provide news and information that we think will interest you (see the Your Choices section below for information about how to opt out of these communications at any time);
Monitor and analyze trends, usage, and activities in connection with our products and services;
Personalize the advertisements you see on third-party platforms and websites (for more information, see the Advertising and Analytics section below);
Facilitate contests, sweepstakes, and promotions;
Sponsor educational or mentorship programs;
Detect, investigate, and help prevent security incidents and other malicious, deceptive, fraudulent, or illegal activity and help protect the rights and property of ETC and others;
Comply with our legal and financial obligations;
Create de-identified, anonymized, or aggregated information; and
Carry out any other purpose described to you at the time the information was collected.
DISCLOSURES OF INFORMATION
We may disclose personal information in the following circumstances or as otherwise described in this policy:

With vendors that access personal information to perform work for us, such as companies that assist us with web hosting, fraud prevention, customer service, and marketing and advertising.
If you choose to use integrations we offer on our Services, such as Google Maps, we may disclose certain information with the integration partners.
If we believe that disclosure is in accordance with, or required by, any applicable law or legal process, including lawful requests by public authorities to meet national security or law enforcement requirements.
If we believe that your actions are inconsistent with our user agreements or policies, if we believe that you have violated the law, or if we believe it is necessary to protect the rights, property, and safety of ETC, our users, the public, or others.
With our lawyers and other professional advisors where necessary to obtain advice or otherwise protect and manage our business interests.
In connection with, or during negotiations concerning, any merger, sale of company assets, financing, or acquisition of all or a portion of our business by another company.
Between and among ETC and our current and future parents, affiliates, and subsidiaries and other companies under common control and ownership.
With your consent or at your direction.
We also use and disclose aggregated or de-identified information that cannot reasonably be used to identify you. ETC processes, maintains, and uses this information only in a de-identified fashion and will not attempt to re-identify such information, except as permitted by law.

ADVERTISING AND ANALYTICS
We engage others to provide perform related services across the web and in mobile apps. These entities may use cookies, web beacons, SDKs, device identifiers, and other technologies to collect information about your use of our Services and other websites and applications, including your IP address and other identifiers, web browser, mobile network information, pages viewed, time spent on pages or in apps, links clicked, and conversion information. This information may be used to deliver advertising and content targeted to your interests on our companies’ sites or mobile apps to analyze and track data, determine the popularity of certain content, and better understand your online activity. For more information about interest-based ads, or to opt out of having your web browsing information used for behavioral advertising purposes by companies that participate in the Digital Advertising Alliance, please visit www.aboutads.info/choices.

TRANSFER OF INFORMATION TO THE UNITED STATES AND OTHER COUNTRIES
ETC is headquartered in the United States, and we have operations and vendors in the United States and other countries. Therefore, we and those that perform work for us may transfer your personal information to, or store or access it in, jurisdictions that may not provide levels of data protection that are equivalent to those of your home jurisdiction. Where required by law, we provide adequate protection for the transfer of personal data in accordance with applicable law, such as by obtaining your consent, relying on adequacy decisions, or executing Standard Contractual Clauses.

YOUR CHOICES
Account Information
You may update and correct certain account information at any time by logging into your account on the Services. If you wish to deactivate your account, please email privacy@etcconnect.com, but note that we may retain certain information as required by law or for our legitimate business purposes.

Cookies
Most web browsers are set to accept cookies by default. If you prefer, you can usually adjust your browser settings to remove or reject browser cookies. Please note that removing or rejecting cookies could affect the availability and functionality of our Services.

Communications Preferences
You may opt out of receiving promotional emails from ETC by following the instructions in those communications. If you opt out, we may still send you non-promotional emails, such as those about your account or our ongoing business relations.

Links to other Websites and Services
We are not responsible for the practices employed by websites or services linked to or from the Services, including the information or content contained in such websites or services, and this Policy does not apply to them. We provide links to products available on third-party websites for your convenience. Your browsing and interaction on any third-party website or service, including those that have a link on or to our Services, are subject to that third party’s own rules and privacy policies. Please read the terms of such websites and applications carefully and exercise care when providing your personal information.

CALIFORNIA AND OTHER STATES NOTICE OF COLLECTION AND PRIVACY RIGHTS
California and Other State Notice of Information Collected and/or Disclosed
The California Consumer Privacy Act or “CCPA” (Cal. Civ. Code § 1798.100 et seq.), as amended by the California Privacy Rights Act (“CPRA”), affords consumers residing in California certain rights with respect to their personal information. In addition, privacy laws in Virginia provide consumers residing in that those states certain rights with respect to their personal information. If you are a California or Virginia resident, this section applies to you as indicated.

If you are a California applicant or employee, employee applicant, or contractor, please refer to the ETC Privacy Notice for California Applicants/Employees for a description of ETC’s privacy practices in that context, and if you are a California business contact, please see our Notice at Collection for California Business Contacts.

We collect and have collected in the preceding 12 months the following categories of personal information:

Category of Personal Information	Examples of Personal Information Collected
Identifiers.	A real name, alias, postal address, online identifier, Internet Protocol address, email address.
California Customer Records or similar information under applicable state privacy laws.	A name, address, telephone number, or any other financial information.
Commercial information.	Records of products or services purchased, obtained, or considered, or other purchasing or consuming histories or tendencies.
Internet or other similar network activity.	Browsing history, search history, information on a Consumer’s interaction with a website, application, or advertisement.
Sensory data.	Audio (such as call recordings).
Professional or employment-related information.	Name of employer, job title.
We collect personal information for the business and commercial purposes described in the Use of Information section above. In the preceding 12 months, we have disclosed the following categories of personal information for business purposes to the following categories of recipients:

Category of Personal Information	Categories of Recipients
Identifiers.	Vendors of infrastructure and software platform providers, cloud services.
California Customer Records.	Vendors of infrastructure and software platform providers, cloud services.
Commercial information.	Vendors and service providers, web hosting and internet service providers, information technology, data analytics, customer service, cloud service, marketing, and advertising.
Internet or other similar network activity.	Vendors and service providers, web hosting and internet service providers, information technology, customer service, cloud service, data analytics, marketing, and advertising.
Audio, electronic, visual, or similar information.	Vendors and service providers, web hosting and internet service providers, and information technology.
Professional or employment-related information.	Vendors and service providers, web hosting and internet service providers, information technology, customer service, cloud service, data analytics, marketing, and advertising.
We do not use or disclose sensitive personal information for the purpose of inferring characteristics about you. We retain personal information for as long as necessary to carry out the purposes for which we originally collected it and for other purposes described in this privacy policy.

Sale of Personal Information
California law requires that we provide transparency about personal information we ”sell.” “Sale” under California law, broadly means scenarios in which we have disclosed personal information with partners in exchange for valuable consideration. In addition, California and other state privacy laws define “sale” to include disclosure of Personal Information with third parties for monetary consideration. In the preceding twelve (12) months, ETC has not sold personal information.

We do not knowingly sell or share personal information about consumers under the age of 16.

Information Relevant to California and Other States
The CPRA requires that we notify you if we “Share” your personal information with third parties. For purposes of the CPRA, “Sharing” means that we make available or otherwise disclose your information to third parties for cross-context behavioral advertising, such as targeting of advertising to you based on your personal information obtained from your activity across businesses, websites, apps, and services other than our Services.

Similarly, Virginia’s privacy law requires that we notify you if we use your information for Targeted Advertising. Targeted Advertising means displaying advertisements to you where the advertisement is selected based on personal information obtained from your activities over time and across nonaffiliated websites or online applications to predict your preferences or interests.

Accordingly, we “Share” and use your information for Targeted Advertising. Specifically, we disclose your identifiers and internet or other network activity with Service Providers and third parties with whom you direct us to disclose your personal information.

To opt out of targeted advertising, sharing, and sales of your personal information, please follow the prompts here. If you are a California resident, you may also opt out of certain “sharing,” “targeted advertising,” and “sales” by visiting our Services with a legally recognized universal choice signal enabled (such as the Global Privacy Control). Please note that, depending on which legally recognized opt-out preference signal you use and whether you are logged into your account with us, our processing of the signal may be limited to the specific browser or device that you are using. You may need to renew your opt-out choice if you use a different browser or device to access our Services.

Privacy Rights
Subject to certain limitations, you have the right to (1) request to know more about the categories and specific pieces of personal information we collect, use, and disclose, (2) request correction of your personal information, (3) request deletion of your personal information, (4) opt out of any “sales” or “sharing” of your personal information that may be occurring, and (5) not be discriminated against for exercising these rights. You may make these requests by calling 877-512-2306 or sending an email to privacy@etcconnect.com. We will verify your request by asking you to provide information related to your recent interactions with us. If you are not satisfied with our response to your Privacy Rights request, you may appeal that response by submitting this Appeals form (link here).

If we receive your request from an authorized agent and they do not provide a valid power of attorney, we may ask the authorized agent to provide proof that you gave the agent signed permission to submit the request to exercise rights on your behalf. In the absence of a valid power of attorney, we may also require you to verify your own identity directly with us or confirm to us that you otherwise provided the authorized agent permission to submit the request. If you are an authorized agent seeking to make a request, please call 877-512-2306.

ADDITIONAL DISCLOSURES FOR INDIVIDUALS IN EUROPE
If you are located in the European Economic Area (“EEA”), the United Kingdom, or Switzerland, you have certain rights and protections under the law regarding the processing of your personal data. Please refer to this Global Privacy Policy for additional disclosures that apply to you.

Data Retention
We store personal data associated with your MyETC or HES forum account for as long as your account remains active. If you close your account, we will delete your account data in accordance with our data retention policy; otherwise, we will delete your account data after six years of inactivity. If you place an order through the ETC Swag Store, we will have to store the personal data relating to such order for at least as long as necessary to fulfill the order and as long as necessary for compliance with statutory tax and accounting requirements in accordance with our Record Retention Policy, even if you do not have a MyETC or HES Forum account or if your MyETC or HES Forum account has meanwhile been deleted. We store other personal data for as long as necessary to carry out the purposes for which we originally collected it and for other legitimate business purposes, including to meet our legal, regulatory, or other compliance obligations.

CONTACTING INFORMATION
If you have any questions or comments about this notice, the ways in which ETC collects and uses your information described above (and in the Electronic Theatre Controls Privacy Policy), your choices and rights regarding such use, or how to exercise your rights under California law, please do not hesitate to contact us at:

Email: privacy@etcconnect.com
